image.altText: A man with very short dark hair in a white button up shirt sits n a flooded balcony looks serious.

props.synopsis: Thomas Ockenfels bought his Canberra apartment more than two years ago, and then realised water was prone to seeping into his bedroom when it rained. His attempts to get his strata company to address the issue have cast light on a growing issue.

title.children: Rain leaks into Thomas's unit and he says his strata isn't helping

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: A Canberra doctor facing 20 charges including rape and assault committed against four young women has been suspended from practising in Australia.

title.children: Canberra doctor charged with sexual assault suspended from practising

image.altText: The exterior of a childcare painted blue with a sign reading "Symonston Kinder Haven" above the door.

props.synopsis: Troubled childcare provider Genius Education is forced to close the doors of yet another of its Canberra centres, this time in Symonston, owing tens of thousands of dollars in unpaid rent.

title.children: Another Genius childcare centre closes owing Canberra landlord thousands in unpaid rent

image.altText: High Court of Australia

props.synopsis: Urgent applications to the High Court and the Federal Court halt the federal government's deportation to Nauru of three members of the NZYQ cohort of non-citizens identified for removal.Â

title.children: Plans to deport three non-citizens to Nauru thwarted by legal challenges

image.altText: Lisa Wilkinson smiling enters Federal Court in Sydney before Bruce Lehrmann defamation judgment, media around

props.synopsis: Network Ten is ordered to pay journalist Lisa Wilkinson more than $1 million to cover costs incurred for her personal legal representation in the Bruce Lehrmann defamation case.

title.children: Network Ten ordered to pay Lisa Wilkinson $1.15m for court costs

image.altText: A woman is approached by an airport worker as she walks through the security area of the airport.

props.synopsis: A magistrate describes a woman's behaviour as "extremely bizarre" as he sentences her for evading security staff and running out onto the tarmac at Canberra Airport in 2023.

title.children: 'Extremely bizarre': Woman fined for running onto Canberra Airport tarmac

image.altText: Governor General Sam Mostyn pins a medal on Doug Boudry's uniform

props.synopsis: The Australian Federal Police (AFP) is refusing to comment on the sudden resignation of one of its most senior figures, who was last year formally decorated for "distinguished service" and until recently was the ACT's deputy chief police officer.Â

title.children: AFP refusing to comment on departure of senior officer

image.altText: Composite image of Morgan Smithies (left) and Hudson Young (right) running the ball for the Canberra Raiders in NRL games.

props.synopsis: Canberra Raiders pair Hudson Young and Morgan Smithies apologise for an incident in a Las Vegas hotel that saw the two "really good mates" briefly kicked out of the building.

title.children: Raiders pair Young and Smithies apologise for Las Vegas 'scuffle'

image.altText: A school sign on the exterior of a large modern building.

props.synopsis: Some Brindabella Christian College staff have not been paid their salaries on time, with the school's executive principal putting the blame on "timing challenges" related to the payment of school fees by parents.

title.children: 'I ask for your patience': Private school principal tells unpaid staff

image.altText: A military service Belgian shepherd sits on the grass in front of the Australian War Memorial.

props.synopsis: A Belgian shepherd who went from pound puppy to decorated combat veteran has been honoured with a new award for distinguished military service at the Australian War Memorial.

title.children: 'The $8 dog' wins prestigious award for military service

image.altText: A woman kisses a baby.

props.synopsis: There are growing calls for an independent inquiry into a series of deaths and medical traumas at Latrobe Regional Hospital.

title.children: More families speak out as pressure builds to review avoidable child deaths

image.altText: A mother with brown hair pulled into a pony tail holds hands and smiles down at her son playing with a blue cord in a park.

props.synopsis: Australians with intellectual disability continue to experience unconscious bias in the medical system and poor health outcomes. Advocates are demanding change.

title.children: The Australians with health outcomes 'like third world countries'

image.altText: A close up shot of Keir Starmer in a room.

props.synopsis: British Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer says the spending boost, worth $26 billion, was designed to counter Russian aggression, amid uncertainty in Europe about the US' commitment to their defence.

title.children: UK to boost defence spending to Cold War levels amid Russian 'menace'

image.altText: An unidentified doctor holds a pile of red, yellow and white complementary medicine pills in their outstretched hands.

props.synopsis: Almost 10 years after being directed to regulate unregistered health practitioners to better protect the public, some parts of Australia still haven't got around to it.

title.children: Calls for greater regulation as people running 'wellness centres out of their living room'

image.altText: Surinder Kumar crouches as he poses with a group of male migrants gathered near a gold coach.

props.synopsis: A perilous journey across continents, jungles and mountains does not always end in the American dream, but some Indian migrants are selling land and risking everything for a chance at life in the US.

title.children: Smuggled, shackled, sent back â Indians risk it all for American dream

image.altText: Picture of Australian one dollar coins stacked on top of note currency

props.synopsis: Increasing amounts of investment dollars are moving into the private realm and the number of companies on stock exchanges is declining, catching the attention of ASIC.

title.children: Why the shift towards private investment has our regulators worried

image.altText: an asian woman applying liner to her eyebrows

props.synopsis: On the surface, these 40-minute-long ads on Facebook and Instagram appear to be make-up tutorials. An ABC NEWS Verify investigation has uncovered how a dubious online store is using them to hawk erectile dysfunction supplements.

title.children: These Facebook ads promise to 'unlock your confidence'. It's porn in disguise

image.altText: Three F1 cars battling for the lead of the race, going around a left-hand corner

props.synopsis: From drivers chasing records to one woman making history, here are the key storylines heading into the 2025 F1 season.

title.children: Record chasers, glory hunters and female history makers, these are F1's talking points

image.altText: Steelworks with man in the foreground

props.synopsis: BlueScope Steel is negotiating with the administrators of the Whyalla Steelworks to join as an expert advisor, but industry insiders believe it may also be interested in a more permanent arrangement.Â

title.children: BlueScope negotiates Whyalla advisory role as it weighs up takeover

image.altText: A smiling woman with tattoos on her arm wearing glasses sitting in a black wheelchair

props.synopsis: Belle Owen was excited to buy her first home, but it was not exactly perfect â a year in, it still is not fully accessible. There are hopes recent changes to the National Construction Code will improve housing options, but some advocates say it does not go far enough.

title.children: National building code changes aim to improve accessibility, but advocates say more could be done

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley smiles as she hold a wrapped present while standing in front of a mural.

props.synopsis: Queensland woman Toyah Cordingley may still have been alive when she was buried on a remote beach, a court has heard.

title.children: Toyah Cordingley may have been buried alive near sand dune, court hears

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A man dressed in a smoking jacket and sailors hat

props.synopsis: Rick Olarenshaw's wife Ni Ketut Sri Astari Saranitha, 36, is on trial for allegedly operating a spa business in Bali that was offering sexual services.

title.children: Estranged wife on trial tells court former AFL star operated illegal Bali brothel

image.altText: A black and white image of a navy ship.

props.synopsis: Three Chinese warships that recently completed live-fire drills in the Tasman Sea have re-entered Australia's Exclusive Economic Zone and are currently being tracked operating east of Hobart.

title.children: Chinese warships tracked heading closer to Tasmania

image.altText: Newborn baby feet

props.synopsis: A private hospital in Tasmania's south says it's preparing to pick up "as many" additional births "as possible" in light of the impending closure of Hobart Private Hospital's maternity services.

title.children: Private operator steps in to deliver solution to maternity services problem

image.altText: A petri dish with a meaty-looking substance in it.

props.synopsis: Twelve people in the Cairns and Townsville areas have now died from the disease since the start of the year.

title.children: 'Havenât seen anything like this': Five more die in melioidosis outbreak

image.altText: A Malaysian Airlines Boeing 777 plane takes off from Kuala Lumpur airport.

props.synopsis: The Malaysian government confirmed that a new search had begun for the wreckage of the plane that vanished nearly 11 years ago with 239 people on board.

title.children: Families of loved ones who were lost on MH370 'relieved' a new search has been launched

image.altText: taiwan coast guard stop and detain a cargo ship in the taiwan straight

props.synopsis: There are fears the incident is the latest in a series of "grey-zone" measures by China designed to pressure Taiwan, which it claims as its own.

title.children: Taiwan detains China-linked cargo ship after undersea cable disconnected

image.altText: A photo of Fyre CEO and convicted fraudster Billy McFarlnad

props.synopsis: Convicted fraudster Billy McFarland is trying to convince people "who believe life is meant to be lived" to buy tickets to his second attempt at a festival.

title.children: Billy McFarland says Fyre Festival 2 is happening. But who would buy tickets?

image.altText: A close up of three people, including two women and one man.

props.synopsis: The ABC has so far spent $1.1 million defending an unlawful termination case brought by former employee Antoinette Lattouf, which was labelled "messy" and "badly handled" during a parliamentary hearing.

title.children: ABC has spent $1.1 million defending case brought by Antoinette Lattouf

image.altText: a mosquito

props.synopsis: A Sydney man dies after contracting Japanese encephalitis while on holiday in southern NSW. It is the state's third confirmed death from the disease since it was first detected in the state in 2022.

title.children: Sydney man dies from mosquito-borne disease picked up while on holiday

image.altText: a close up of the microsoft logo, a window coloured red, green, blue, yellow

props.synopsis: Microsoft has increased the price of its Microsoft 365 subscriptions, which it says has new AI features, but the price hike caused consumer outrage.

title.children: 'Arrogance is astounding': Microsoft subscription price hike brings backlash

image.altText: A middle-aged man wearing glasses wearing a scout uniform standing next to a woman in a community hall.

props.synopsis: Graham John Phillips, 58, is currently on bail charged with one count of soliciting child abuse material and one count of possessing child abuse material.

title.children: NSW paramedic charged with possessing child sex abuse material

image.altText: A police crime scene

props.synopsis: A dispute between neighbours over loud music escalated into a street fight where a woman was doused in flammable liquid and set on fire with a blowtorch, a Victorian court has heard.

title.children: Court hears woman set on fire after neighbourhood dispute over loud music

image.altText: Dan Bongino speaks at a Conservative political Action Committee conference in 2014

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump announced the appointment in a post on his Truth Social platform, praising Dan Bongino as "a man of incredible love and passion for our country".

title.children: Podcaster picked by Trump for FBI deputy says 'cutesy time is over'
